media.caption: A Year of Cloud Club Activities
media.credit: by AWS Academic Advocacy in Developer Relations

text.headline: A Year of Cloud Club Activities for Cloud Club Captains
text.text: A timeline of how you can build your AWS Cloud Club

text.headline: January
text.text:
In your first meeting, use these slides to demonstrate your club's capability. Be sure to invite someone from Academic Advocacy to this event if it's online!

Download them from the Captain's Library on Box.com.

text.headline: February
text.text: In your second month's meeting, invite an AWS speaker to speak at your Club using this form.

text.headline: March
text.text: Get together for a Cloud Quest tournament. Cloud Quest Cloud Practitioner is a free gamified experience on Skill Builder. You can host a Cloud Quest tournament for your Club. Take a look at Cloud Quest.

text.headline: April
text.text: It's time for Camp! Ask us to provision a Camp experience for your Club, and have the opportunity to earn cool NFTs! Preview the Infrastructure Camp.

text.headline: May
text.text: Do a workshop together as a Club. We've built one just for you, to teach web development and serverless technologies. Ask us to provision our Amplify Workshop for your Club.

text.headline: June
text.text: Gather together for resume reviews. Fill out this form to organize a panel of AWS employees to look at your Club members' resume or LinkedIn profiles and give feedback. Image credit.

text.headline: July
text.text: Use your Builder Cards to host a game night. Builder Cards are part of your Club's 'Club Swag' pack and are a cool deckbuilding game to play together to learn about architecting in the Cloud. Learn more about Builder Cards.

text.headline: August
text.text: Do an Exam Cram, and prepare your Club members to take the AWS Cloud Practitioner or Solutions Architect Exam using free Skill Builder courses. Ask us about getting vouchers.

text.headline: September
text.text: Gather with your Club for a Deep Racer Student League Tournament. Deep Racer Student League allows you to learn about Reinforcement Leaerning and race cars as a League, all online.

text.headline: October
text.text: Hold a Machine Learning Watch Party, perhaps partnering with another Club. MLU has a YouTube Channel with dozens of high quality videos - learn together with MLU!

text.headline: November
text.text: Pick a notebook and run it together on SageMaker Studio Lab. This environment allows you to run Jupyter notebooks for free, in the Cloud.

text.headline: December
text.text: Walk through any tutorial on community.aws together as a club and host an end-of-the-year party! You can also do a re:Invent re:Cap activity, watching the videos from the re:Invent conference as a Club.
